physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Born at 37 weeks gestation with intrauterine growth retardation, birth weight 2100 g (-2.5 SDS), length 47 cm (-1.7 SDS), normal head circumference (33.5 cm). Diabetes diagnosed at 3 days of life based on glucosuria and hyperglycemia (glucose 16.3 mmol/liter), undetectable serum insulin (<3.0 mU/liter).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Continuous insulin requirement since birth, with doses of 0.6â€“0.9 U/kg per day at discharge.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Younger half-brother born at 39 weeks gestation with birth weight 2450 g (0.0 SDS), normal length and head circumference. Weight loss noted at 10 days of age, presented with dehydration and voracious appetite at 17 days, diagnosed with diabetes (hyperglycemia 27.3 mmol/liter, glucosuria). Serum insulin level at diagnosis was undetectable (<14 pmol/liter).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: On insulin therapy at discharge, doses ranging from 0.55 to 0.75 U/kg per day. Management included switching to an insulin pump at 6 months, with large swings in blood glucose but no severe hypoglycemia.
